trans-unit.source: Connect to SQL Database by using Java with JDBC on Windows
trans-unit.target: Connect to SQL Database by using Java with JDBC on Windows

trans-unit.source: Presents a Java code sample you can use to connect to Azure SQL Database. The sample uses JDBC, and it runs on a Windows client computer.
trans-unit.target: Presents a Java code sample you can use to connect to Azure SQL Database. The sample uses JDBC, and it runs on a Windows client computer.

trans-unit.source: This topic presents a Java code sample that you can use to connect to Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: This topic presents a Java code sample that you can use to connect to Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: The Java sample relies on the Java Development Kit (JDK) version 1.8.
trans-unit.target: The Java sample relies on the Java Development Kit (JDK) version 1.8.

trans-unit.source: The sample connects to an Azure SQL Database by using the JDBC driver.
trans-unit.target: The sample connects to an Azure SQL Database by using the JDBC driver.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Microsoft JDBC Driver for SQL Server - SQL JDBC 4</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Microsoft JDBC Driver for SQL Server - SQL JDBC 4</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Any operating system platform that runs <linkText>Java Development Kit 1.8</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Any operating system platform that runs <linkText>Java Development Kit 1.8</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: An existing database on SQL Azure.
trans-unit.target: An existing database on SQL Azure.

trans-unit.source: See the <linkText>Get Started topic</linkText><title></title> to learn how to create a sample database and retrieve your connection string.
trans-unit.target: See the <linkText>Get Started topic</linkText><title></title> to learn how to create a sample database and retrieve your connection string.

trans-unit.source: The Java code example in this topic assumes the following test table already exists in your Azure SQL Database database.
trans-unit.target: The Java code example in this topic assumes the following test table already exists in your Azure SQL Database database.

trans-unit.source: The code sample creates a Connection object by using a connection string.
trans-unit.target: The code sample creates a Connection object by using a connection string.

trans-unit.source: You can find the connection string by using the <linkText>Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You can find the connection string by using the <linkText>Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For details about finding the connection string, see <linkText>Create your first Azure SQL Database</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For details about finding the connection string, see <linkText>Create your first Azure SQL Database</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The section contains the bulk of the Java code sample.
trans-unit.target: The section contains the bulk of the Java code sample.

trans-unit.source: It has comments indicating where you would copy-and-paste the smaller Java segments that are presented in subsequent sections.
trans-unit.target: It has comments indicating where you would copy-and-paste the smaller Java segments that are presented in subsequent sections.

trans-unit.source: The sample in this section could compile and run even without the copy-and-pastes near the comments, but it would only connect and then end.
trans-unit.target: The sample in this section could compile and run even without the copy-and-pastes near the comments, but it would only connect and then end.

trans-unit.source: The comments you will find are the following:
trans-unit.target: The comments you will find are the following:

trans-unit.source: // INSERT two rows into the table.
trans-unit.target: // INSERT two rows into the table.

trans-unit.source: // TRANSACTION and commit for an UPDATE.
trans-unit.target: // TRANSACTION and commit for an UPDATE.

trans-unit.source: // SELECT rows from the table.
trans-unit.target: // SELECT rows from the table.

trans-unit.source: Here next is the bulk of the Java code sample.
trans-unit.target: Here next is the bulk of the Java code sample.

trans-unit.source: The sample includes the main function of the SQLDatabaseTest class.
trans-unit.target: The sample includes the main function of the SQLDatabaseTest class.

trans-unit.source: Of course, to actually run the preceding Java code sample, you would have to put your real values into the connection string to replace the placeholders:
trans-unit.target: Of course, to actually run the preceding Java code sample, you would have to put your real values into the connection string to replace the placeholders:

trans-unit.source: your_server
trans-unit.target: your_server

trans-unit.source: your_database
trans-unit.target: your_database

trans-unit.source: your_user
trans-unit.target: your_user

trans-unit.source: your_password
trans-unit.target: your_password

trans-unit.source: This Java segment issues a Transact-SQL INSERT statement to insert two rows into the Person table.
trans-unit.target: This Java segment issues a Transact-SQL INSERT statement to insert two rows into the Person table.

trans-unit.source: The general sequence is as follows:
trans-unit.target: The general sequence is as follows:

trans-unit.source: Generate a PreparedStatement object by using the Connection object.
trans-unit.target: Generate a PreparedStatement object by using the Connection object.

trans-unit.source: We include the parameter Statement.RETURN_GENERATED_KEYS so that later we can obtain the value that was automatically generated for the id key value.
trans-unit.target: We include the parameter Statement.RETURN_GENERATED_KEYS so that later we can obtain the value that was automatically generated for the id key value.

trans-unit.source: Call the execute method on the PreparedStatement object.
trans-unit.target: Call the execute method on the PreparedStatement object.

trans-unit.source: Obtain the numeric value that was automatically generated for the primary key, by using the PreparedStatement object.
trans-unit.target: Obtain the numeric value that was automatically generated for the primary key, by using the PreparedStatement object.

trans-unit.source: This relates to the AUTO_INCREMENT specification on the id column in the Person table
trans-unit.target: This relates to the AUTO_INCREMENT specification on the id column in the Person table

trans-unit.source: Copy-and-paste this short Java segment into the primary code sample where you see the comment // INSERT two rows into the table..
trans-unit.target: Copy-and-paste this short Java segment into the primary code sample where you see the comment // INSERT two rows into the table..

trans-unit.source: The following segment of Java code issues a Transact-SQL UPDATE statement to increase the age value for every row in the person table.
trans-unit.target: The following segment of Java code issues a Transact-SQL UPDATE statement to increase the age value for every row in the person table.

trans-unit.source: The general sequence is as follows:
trans-unit.target: The general sequence is as follows:

trans-unit.source: The setAutoCommit method is called to prevent updates from being automatically committed in the database.
trans-unit.target: The setAutoCommit method is called to prevent updates from being automatically committed in the database.

trans-unit.source: The executeUpdate method is called to execute the UPDATE in the context of transaction.
trans-unit.target: The executeUpdate method is called to execute the UPDATE in the context of transaction.

trans-unit.source: The commit method is called to explicitly commit the transaction.
trans-unit.target: The commit method is called to explicitly commit the transaction.

trans-unit.source: Copy-and-paste this short Java segment into the primary code sample where you see the comment // TRANSACTION and commit for an UPDATE..
trans-unit.target: Copy-and-paste this short Java segment into the primary code sample where you see the comment // TRANSACTION and commit for an UPDATE..

trans-unit.source: This Java segment executes a Transact-SQL SELECT statement to see all the updated rows from the Person table.
trans-unit.target: This Java segment executes a Transact-SQL SELECT statement to see all the updated rows from the Person table.

trans-unit.source: The general sequence is as follows:
trans-unit.target: The general sequence is as follows:

trans-unit.source: Generate a Statement object by using the Connection object.
trans-unit.target: Generate a Statement object by using the Connection object.

trans-unit.source: Generate a ResultSet object by using the Statement object.
trans-unit.target: Generate a ResultSet object by using the Statement object.

trans-unit.source: Loop around a call to resultSet.next to iterate through all the returned rows.
trans-unit.target: Loop around a call to resultSet.next to iterate through all the returned rows.

trans-unit.source: Copy-and-paste this short Java segment into the primary code sample where you see the comment // SELECT rows from a table..
trans-unit.target: Copy-and-paste this short Java segment into the primary code sample where you see the comment // SELECT rows from a table..
